section.name: Installing Custom Tranports
section.p: The InfoQuiver distribution contains a little commandline tool called "TransportInstaller". It makes the installation of new transports as simple as it's possible in InfoQuivers current development stage.
section.subsection:
Before using the TransportInstaller ensure that both - your transport class and the transport xml descriptor - are located in the same directory. java net.sf.iquiver.tools.TransportInstaller -fTorque ... transport
fTorque: specifies the path to the configuration file with settings for the persistence layer
As long as you are not a InfoQuiver developer this setting should be PathToInfoQuiverInstallDir/conf/torque.properties
transport: specifies the class containing your transport implementation, eg. net.sf.iquiver.samples.transport.SimpleFetchTransport
